[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-02 22:09:27.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/util.py', 'pbr/builddoc.py'], 'message': "Don't raise exception on missing man pages

The revert in Ia6cfbfe5b10a5b714fbb9f21ca61380aaf231638 actually
broke Sphinx 1.3.x support again. Try to fix it for real this
time by avoiding an exception on missing man_pages.

NOTE(dmllr): don't change dict while iterating over it, hopefully

Change-Id: I52d45fa0a0d42de690d3a492068f7bb03483a224
Related-Bug: 1379998
"}]
commit_message:
Don't raise exception on missing man pages

The revert in Ia6cfbfe5b10a5b714fbb9f21ca61380aaf231638 actually
broke Sphinx 1.3.x support again. Try to fix it for real this
time by avoiding an exception on missing man_pages.

NOTE(dmllr): don't change dict while iterating over it, hopefully
this fixes the gating failure with python 3.5.x

Change-Id: I52d45fa0a0d42de690d3a492068f7bb03483a224
Related-Bug: 1379998

commit_message:
Clean up kolla-ansible related files from Kolla

- Remove globals.yml and passwords.yml files.
- The gate was still using these files from the kolla
directory. Modified the gate to prevent using these files
from the kolla directory.
- Modified the deploy_aio.sh file to populate passwords
in passwords.yml using kolla-ansible.

Change-Id: I1ed7849d54cab6d5a9217dced73327ea13f06636
Closes-Bug: #1653035

subject: Prevent attempts to "filter" list() calls by globally unique IDs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 23633, 'name': 'Arthur Miranda', 'email': 'artmr@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'artmr'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-10-14 17:47:00.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_domains.py', 'keystoneclient/base.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_federation.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/utils.py'], 'message': 'Prevent attempts to "filter" list() calls by globally unique IDs

This use case isn't covered by our current APIs:

GET /entities?entity_id={entity_id}

Because we have a dedicated API for that:

GET /entities/{entity_id}

Three scenarios of same use case are possible:

1. The id parameter as 'id' (entities?id={entity_id})
Raises the expected exception:  TypeError: list() got an unexpected
keyword argument 'id'.

2. The id parameter as 'entity_id', with existent id value
Raises KeyError

3. The id parameter as 'entity_id', with unexistent id value
Raises NotFound (404)

This change raises a client-side TypeError for these three scenarios

Change-Id: I73b9387821a51afe91f29c37060e668f71c8a5ad
Closes-Bug:#1628253
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent attempts to "filter" list() calls by globally unique IDs

This use case isn't covered by our current APIs:

GET /entities?entity_id={entity_id}

Because we have a dedicated API for that:

GET /entities/{entity_id}

Three scenarios of same use case are possible:

1. The id parameter as 'id' (entities?id={entity_id})
Raises the expected exception:  TypeError: list() got an unexpected
keyword argument 'id'.

2. The id parameter as 'entity_id', with existent id value
Raises KeyError

3. The id parameter as 'entity_id', with unexistent id value
Raises NotFound (404)

This change raises a client-side TypeError for these three scenarios

Change-Id: I73b9387821a51afe91f29c37060e668f71c8a5ad
Closes-Bug:#1628253

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-05 14:26:48.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_services.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_domains.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_role_assignments.py', 'keystoneclient/base.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_endpoints.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_projects.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_users.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_roles.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/utils.py'], 'message': 'Prevent attempts to "filter" find() calls by globally unique IDs

This use case isn't covered by our current APIs:

  GET /entities?id={entity_id}
  GET /entities?entity_id={entity_id}

Because we have a dedicated API for that:

  GET /entities/{entity_id}

But our find() methods generally support **kwargs, which are passed as
query parameters to keystone. When an 'id' or 'entity_id' is passed to
keystone as a query parameter, keystone rightly ignores it and returns
an unfiltered collection.

This change raises a client-side TypeError (as you'd expect when you try
to pass a keyword argument that a function isn't expecting), and
includes a helpful suggestion to try calling get() instead.

Change-Id: Id7c89de06f71182e2b290664aa32ffb4e27f3307
Closes-Bug:#1626640
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent attempts to "filter" find() calls by globally unique IDs

This use case isn't covered by our current APIs:

  GET /entities?id={entity_id}
  GET /entities?entity_id={entity_id}

Because we have a dedicated API for that:

  GET /entities/{entity_id}

But our find() methods generally support **kwargs, which are passed as
query parameters to keystone. When an 'id' or 'entity_id' is passed to
keystone as a query parameter, keystone rightly ignores it and returns
an unfiltered collection.

This change raises a client-side TypeError (as you'd expect when you try
to pass a keyword argument that a function isn't expecting), and
includes a helpful suggestion to try calling get() instead.

Change-Id: Id7c89de06f71182e2b290664aa32ffb4e27f3307
Closes-Bug:#1626640

commit_message:
Disable networking during bootstrapping

There is no reason to have networking active while bootstrapping the
initial mysql folder structure. It is an additional attack vector that
serves no purpose.

Change-Id: Ia636ba9f563dbfb969dbfb613198c98748ee8a3c

commit_message:
Fix failing gate jobs due to removal of nova_client.service_catalog

Nova community has removed support of HTTPClient [1] thus they have
removed service_catalog as well. Services which are going to call nova
has to use SessionClient only. It is recommended to use
keystoneauth1.service_catalog and not nova_client.service_catalog as it
is removed in commit [1].

We are already using SessionClient. This patch uses the service_catalog
from keystoneauth1.

NOTE:
novaclient will be called only with admin_endpoint and privileged_user.
So there is no need to form url for normal user. So removed unused code
from masakari.compute.nova.py

[1] 2e5576dafc21906a95196054f85c80b57c48663a

Closes-Bug: #1653052
Change-Id: I2a28eb94e190cd0416d0d7ea56af8f7ca76dbae5

commit_message:
Don't apply multi-queue to SRIOV ports

The multi-queue feature was added:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-virtio-net-multiqueue
and it is controlled using image metadata:
hw_vif_mutliqueue_enabled=true|false

when users want to launch an instance with
a SRIOV port and several normal ports
with multi-queue feature, ERROR can take
place due to wrong driver name for SRIOV
interface. Details could be found in bug
description.

Change-Id: I52c51ff17f43133154f6ea8aa4107f1673f82dde
Closes-bug: #1641814

commit_message:
Support /usr/share and /usr/share/$project for config dirs

In addition to ~ and /etc, also support /usr/share .
This is useful for distributions to deliver adjusted default config
files which can be adjusted with package updates.

subject: Use local facts for ansible_architecture
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-22 16:12:37.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat-7.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/galera_package_arch-913fb39b07a139fd.yaml', 'vars/ubuntu-16.04.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Use local facts for ansible_architecture

This patch ensure the local host's ansible facts are used for the
"ansible_architecture" fact, rather than the "physical_host". Since we
don't explicitly collect facts for "physical_host", and the
ansible_architecture fact is set for the local host container, we
don't need to try to retrieve the "physical_host" facts.

A new var "galera_package_arch" is created so that the architecture can
be overriden if it isn't being calculated correctly. Additionally, the
duplicate vars that are not specific to distributions have been moved
into defaults, and out of the specific distribution vars files.

Change-Id: I5124c061faf124388a88eefee93d96e9a9e90d8f
Closes-Bug: 1650384
'}]
commit_message:
Use local facts for ansible_architecture

This patch ensure the local host's ansible facts are used for the
"ansible_architecture" fact, rather than the "physical_host". Since we
don't explicitly collect facts for "physical_host", and the
ansible_architecture fact is set for the local host container, we
don't need to try to retrieve the "physical_host" facts.

A new var "galera_package_arch" is created so that the architecture can
be overriden if it isn't being calculated correctly. Additionally, the
duplicate vars that are not specific to distributions have been moved
into defaults, and out of the specific distribution vars files.

Change-Id: I5124c061faf124388a88eefee93d96e9a9e90d8f
Closes-Bug: 1650384

commit_message:
add composable services deployment support for oooq

add the list of services and roles in a jinja template which
will build the heat environment file for deploying the required
services and roles depending on the config provided

This change is related to the keystone_only config file review:
https://review.openstack.org/410831

Change-Id: I9eb568ed0088ffdef45105b1606ecdcb1db24f7c

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-02 14:46:59.000000000', 'files': ['tests/noop/spec/hosts/rabbitmq/rabbitmq_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.pp', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/rabbitmq_ocf.pp'], 'message': "Refactor rabbitmq ordering

- Refactor Service_status['rabbitmq'] in pacemaker and non pacemaker
  mode. As a part cmd_check was changed to 'rabbitmqctl
  node_health_check && rabbitmqctl cluster_status' as cluster_status may
  fail due to issues on other nodes. Also it doesn't have timeout thus
  operation may hang up. Instead node_health_check will check the node
  and check cluster on success.
- Staging::File as MODULES-1650 has been merged
- Specify ordering between rabbitmq_user_permissions and rabbitmq_user
- Write test that verifies that service is before the actual user

Change-Id: I876ab09d687916195dcb82633f0242fc823c0357
Closes-Bug: #1652268
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor rabbitmq ordering

- Refactor Service_status['rabbitmq'] in pacemaker and non pacemaker
  mode. As a part cmd_check was changed to 'rabbitmqctl
  node_health_check && rabbitmqctl cluster_status' as cluster_status may
  fail due to issues on other nodes. Also it doesn't have timeout thus
  operation may hang up. Instead node_health_check will check the node
  and check cluster on success.
- Staging::File as MODULES-1650 has been merged
- Specify ordering between rabbitmq_user_permissions and rabbitmq_user
- Write test that verifies that service is before the actual user

Change-Id: I876ab09d687916195dcb82633f0242fc823c0357
Closes-Bug: #1652268
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix ci

The devstack plugin carries usage of `sudo -u` which doesn't seem to
work in the ci environment.  Replace it with sudo followed by
appropriate permissions changes.
Use ${DEST} instead of literal /opt/stack to fit with gate usage.
Enabled monasca-api plugin in the settings and the required monasca
services along with zookeeper.

Change-Id: I6effede4ac9a2faf1c44eff9cd96bbf9c924d703

commit_message:
Fix bug when using multiple DeployArtifactURLs

The script tries to download all artifact URLs with a single
request, instead of downloading each URL on its own if
multiple DeployArtifactURLs were given.

Closes-Bug: #1649303
Change-Id: I6a8be699aff7023a67702bb1d3ddc2273984cd08
(cherry picked from commit f7e8a043d92bdf759768d9cded62130425af6f64)

subject: Use df instead of findmnt in cephstorage upgrade scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 20:22:42.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_ceph_storage.sh'], 'message': 'Use df instead of findmnt in cephstorage upgrade scripts

There are scenarios in which findmnt will return a list of all
mounted filesystems, which causes the upgrade script to fail in
recognizing if the Ceph OSD is backed by ext4.

Change-Id: Iadebdc32b523c05216202b782ceb54bec4389413
Closes-Bug: #1649407
(cherry picked from commit 623c24978294d86513180cf0419536eb30547a2f)
'}]
commit_message:
Use df instead of findmnt in cephstorage upgrade scripts

There are scenarios in which findmnt will return a list of all
mounted filesystems, which causes the upgrade script to fail in
recognizing if the Ceph OSD is backed by ext4.

Change-Id: Iadebdc32b523c05216202b782ceb54bec4389413
Closes-Bug: #1649407
(cherry picked from commit 623c24978294d86513180cf0419536eb30547a2f)

This should also help new users who sometimes copy/paste old templates

Change-Id: Ib415e7290fea27447460baa280291492df197e54

commit_message:
Bump template version for all templates to "ocata"

Heat now supports release name aliases, so we can replace
the inconsistent mix of date related versions with one consistent
version that aligns with the supported version of heat for this
t-h-t branch.

This should also help new users who sometimes copy/paste old templates
and discover intrinsic functions in the t-h-t docs don't work because
their template version is too old.

Change-Id: Ib415e7290fea27447460baa280291492df197e54

subject: Enforce project_safe checking for admin users
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-03 07:12:43.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/db/test_cluster_api.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/actions/test_action_base.py', 'senlin/engine/scheduler.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/db/test_profile_api.py', 'senlin/engine/actions/base.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/db/test_action_api.py', 'senlin/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/db/test_event_api.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/db/test_policy_api.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_scheduler.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/db/test_node_api.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/db/test_receiver_api.py'], 'message': "Enforce project_safe checking for admin users

Admin users are designed to retrieve objects from all projects even
take actions on them, this will cause a lot problems, for example:
1. name_unique checking issue:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/senlin/+bug/1652742
2. cluster-node-add, admin user can add projectB's node to projectA's
  cluster
Admin users should respect the project concepts as well, this patch
enforces project_safe checking fro admin users. And as for some actions
that admin users should be authorized to retrieve things from all projects,
will be added in following patches.

Change-Id: I7103efabccbb4d10c2572e2df51a38ade009df84
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce project_safe checking for admin users

Admin users are designed to retrieve objects from all projects even
take actions on them, this will cause a lot problems, for example:
1. name_unique checking issue:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/senlin/+bug/1652742
2. cluster-node-add, admin user can add projectB's node to projectA's
  cluster
Admin users should respect the project concepts as well, this patch
enforces project_safe checking fro admin users. And as for some actions
that admin users should be authorized to retrieve things from all projects,
will be added in following patches.

Change-Id: I7103efabccbb4d10c2572e2df51a38ade009df84

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-02 03:48:10.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/objects/notification.py', 'senlin/objects/fields.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/objects/test_notification.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/objects/test_fields.py'], 'message': "Remove NotificationAction field type

The original design was limiting the actions to be built in action
names. However, when we add new operations (supported by profile types),
this is becoming a restriction.
Considering that this field type is only used internally, we don't need
to apply an unnecessarily restriction here.

Change-Id: I2688d9595e7e22c22150a1c3592df1ac4e62a07e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove NotificationAction field type

The original design was limiting the actions to be built in action
names. However, when we add new operations (supported by profile types),
this is becoming a restriction.
Considering that this field type is only used internally, we don't need
to apply an unnecessarily restriction here.

Change-Id: I2688d9595e7e22c22150a1c3592df1ac4e62a07e

subject: Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 02:34:29.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_clusapi_utils.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/dns/test_dnsutils.py'], 'message': 'Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented
by using != operator to compare two dicts. So is assertEqual()
in testtools. assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dict,
list, set and so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the
unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: I71508671b5a88640a8f337410566ca2889411c9e
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented
by using != operator to compare two dicts. So is assertEqual()
in testtools. assertEqual() in testtools is able to handle dict,
list, set and so on. So we just call assertEqual() to make the
unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: I71508671b5a88640a8f337410566ca2889411c9e

commit_message:
Fix for VM's not getting IP due to missing SG rules

This patch set fixes missing outbound/inbound rules due
to missing SG rules due to synchronizatin issues while
adding and removing rules seen on a scale environment

Removes sleep calls from networkutils. These calls should
be done outside os-win, if necessary.

Change-Id: I91aec85f00a1e9d1bd51b646521b538695762259
Co-Authored-By: sonu <sonu.sudhakaran@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: ShivaKumar M <shiva.kum.m@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Vinod Kumar <vinod.kumar5@hpe.com>
Closes-Bug: 1591114

subject: Adds VLAN trunk mode support
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-16 13:53:12.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/constants.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/network/test_networkutils.py', 'os_win/utils/network/networkutils.py'], 'message': 'Adds VLAN trunk mode support

NetworkUtils.set_vswitch_port_vlan_id can now set
VLAN trunks. The method can receive a few new arguments:

* operation_mode: specifies the VLAN operation mode for the
given switch port. Acceptable values: os_win.constants.VLAN_MODE_ACCESS,
os_win.constants.VLAN_MODE_TRUNK. If not given, VLAN_MODE_ACCESS will be
set.
* trunk_vlans: a list of VLAN IDs that will be set in Trunk Mode for the
given switch port. If the given operation_mode is VLAN_MODE_ACCESS, an
AttributeError is raised if a non-None trunk_vlans is given.

Implements: blueprint os-win-vlan-trunks

Change-Id: I0de69f88cc52d8904579e18678e0be8d77bd9a76
'}]
commit_message:
Adds VLAN trunk mode support

NetworkUtils.set_vswitch_port_vlan_id can now set
VLAN trunks. The method can receive a few new arguments:

* operation_mode: specifies the VLAN operation mode for the
given switch port. Acceptable values: os_win.constants.VLAN_MODE_ACCESS,
os_win.constants.VLAN_MODE_TRUNK. If not given, VLAN_MODE_ACCESS will be
set.
* trunk_vlans: a list of VLAN IDs that will be set in Trunk Mode for the
given switch port. If the given operation_mode is VLAN_MODE_ACCESS, an
AttributeError is raised if a non-None trunk_vlans is given.

Implements: blueprint os-win-vlan-trunks

Change-Id: I0de69f88cc52d8904579e18678e0be8d77bd9a76

subject: Add Constraints support
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-22 22:51:02.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove cliff and at the same time pull any required
libraries from git.

Change-Id: Idb9c4a0aa0022cc5b61f9e44ca6c24de9e10ea68
"}]
commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove cliff and at the same time pull any required
libraries from git.

Change-Id: Idb9c4a0aa0022cc5b61f9e44ca6c24de9e10ea68

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove os-win.

Change-Id: Idd9640825566eae61aa5776550c12f52c15a0ad1

subject: tox: rename zeromq target
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-01-02 10:34:07.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt', 'tox.ini', 'oslo_messaging/tests/functional/gate/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': 'tox: rename zeromq target

The current zeromq target name are too long and reach the limitation
of 127 chars of the sheband of the virtualenv binary.

A target name must not be more than 22 chars to run in gate with
the tox job template.

This renames them to a shorter one.

It also creates aliases for the legacy jobs that we will remove
when the tox jobs are ready.

Change-Id: I5cbc368e7ea252f8c0c949c8e7ee3a70a560db22
'}]
commit_message:
tox: rename zeromq target

The current zeromq target name are too long and reach the limitation
of 127 chars of the sheband of the virtualenv binary.

A target name must not be more than 22 chars to run in gate with
the tox job template.

This renames them to a shorter one.

It also creates aliases for the legacy jobs that we will remove
when the tox jobs are ready.

Change-Id: I5cbc368e7ea252f8c0c949c8e7ee3a70a560db22

subject: carbonara: log a message and do not fail if a file is missing
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-12-13 16:40:06.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py', 'gnocchi/tests/test_storage.py', 'gnocchi/carbonara.py'], 'message': 'carbonara: log a message and do not fail if a file is missing

When rewriting data for compression, it's possible a file
<metric>_<splitkey>_<aggregation_method>_<granularity> is missing,
because of some data corruption. In that case the following traceback happens:

  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 557, in process_new_measures
      ignore_too_old_timestamps=True)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/carbonara.py", line 217, in set_values
      before_truncate_callback(self)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 551, in _map_add_measures
      for aggregation in agg_methods))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 675, in _map_no_thread
      return list(itertools.starmap(method, list_of_args))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 316, in _add_measures
      oldest_mutable_timestamp)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 249, in _store_timeserie_split
      offset, data = split.serialize(key, compressed=write_full)
  AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'serialize'

This patch makes the driver log a warning and return, so it just ignores
the failure and continues anyway.

Change-Id: I4f367b2418c8be0067746c88bcce74ca756acf4e
'}]
commit_message:
carbonara: log a message and do not fail if a file is missing

When rewriting data for compression, it's possible a file
<metric>_<splitkey>_<aggregation_method>_<granularity> is missing,
because of some data corruption. In that case the following traceback happens:

  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 557, in process_new_measures
      ignore_too_old_timestamps=True)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/carbonara.py", line 217, in set_values
      before_truncate_callback(self)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 551, in _map_add_measures
      for aggregation in agg_methods))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 675, in _map_no_thread
      return list(itertools.starmap(method, list_of_args))
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 316, in _add_measures
      oldest_mutable_timestamp)
    File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py", line 249, in _store_timeserie_split
      offset, data = split.serialize(key, compressed=write_full)
  AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'serialize'

This patch makes the driver log a warning and return, so it just ignores
the failure and continues anyway.

Change-Id: I4f367b2418c8be0067746c88bcce74ca756acf4e

Rst2bash will be part of Documentation team and follow an independent
release model. Rst2bash primarily focuses on validating install guides
by parsing the RST to Bash and running the generated bash code using
training-labs for deploying OpenStack cluster. Additionally also
generate OpenStack deployment scripts for training-labs.

Change-Id: Ie38a69fb2a64216122f2a9feffdf35218356453f
Depends-On: Ibbafbaae49279acf2bf63e5cdd19b1f0433f826d

commit_message:
Create project rst2bash

Rst2bash will be part of Documentation team and follow an independent
release model. Rst2bash primarily focuses on validating install guides
by parsing the RST to Bash and running the generated bash code using
training-labs for deploying OpenStack cluster. Additionally also
generate OpenStack deployment scripts for training-labs.

Change-Id: Ie38a69fb2a64216122f2a9feffdf35218356453f
Depends-On: Ibbafbaae49279acf2bf63e5cdd19b1f0433f826d

subject: Replace oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-20 04:08:17.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/utils.py'], 'message': "Replace oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Function 'oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()' is deprecated in version '1.6'
and will be removed in a future version. We cant't use
datetime.datetime.isoformat() instead. Because the format of the string
generated by isoformat isn't the same as the format of the string
generated by isotime. The string is used in tokens and other public
APIs and we can't change it without potentially breaking clients.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() to utils.py

For more informations:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/timeutils.html#oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Change-Id: Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e
Closes-Bug: #1461251
"}]
commit_message:
Replace oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Function 'oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()' is deprecated in version '1.6'
and will be removed in a future version. We cant't use
datetime.datetime.isoformat() instead. Because the format of the string
generated by isoformat isn't the same as the format of the string
generated by isotime. The string is used in tokens and other public
APIs and we can't change it without potentially breaking clients.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime() to utils.py

For more informations:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/timeutils.html#oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Change-Id: Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e
Closes-Bug: #1461251

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 09:02:35.000000000', 'files': ['disaster_recovery/api/api.py'], 'message': "Replace directly import of logging with import oslo_log

The oslo.log (logging) configuration library provides standardized
configuration for all openstack projects. It also provides custom
formatters, handlers and support for context specific
logging (like resource id's etc).

In addition, freezer-web-ui should be consistent with freezer in terms
of style commandments, for
more information,see:
https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/HACKING.rst

Change-Id: I99499c2b16bd7f7fec1be8ebc72f7632994576cc
"}]
commit_message:
Replace directly import of logging with import oslo_log

The oslo.log (logging) configuration library provides standardized
configuration for all openstack projects. It also provides custom
formatters, handlers and support for context specific
logging (like resource id's etc).

In addition, freezer-web-ui should be consistent with freezer in terms
of style commandments, for
more information,see:
https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/HACKING.rst

Change-Id: I99499c2b16bd7f7fec1be8ebc72f7632994576cc

commit_message:
Use assertGreater() or assertLess()

assertGreater() or assertLess()
will return nicer error if it fails.
So we use assertGreater() or assertLess()
to replace assertTrue()

Change-Id: Ic90ebbb8f1d3b0c4d8ee8d317a31dd0d85335a5d

commit_message:
Add the "has" DB filter

* This filter is needed for search functionality when we don't need
  to rely on full match. Instead, we should be able to find entities
  by inclusion of a value into a specified field.

Change-Id: I2133493e5b79b59994c7ef6b0e50b6ba1e1d37c6

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should
call 'raise' without any arguments because it shows
the place where an exception occured initially instead
of place where the exception re-raised

Change-Id: I835bf6d508793ec97c94fab8dc1d3e8234b7d063

commit_message:
Fix BDM JSON-Schema validation

Current BDM JSON-Schema validation doesn't work for invalid device
parameter in 2nd dict, because JSON-Schema definition is wrong.
This patch fixes it.

Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I56348dc2b7abd9526dfbf21305755505765811c5
Closes-Bug: #1651064
(cherry picked from commit a65551ecd09b3116a13d9b6cc833be0c05b716da)

commit_message:
Skip release 0.13.1 for docutils

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs when it tries to build
docs with remote images. This has been reported upstream[0]. The version
matches the supported docutils versions for sphinx.

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/

Change-Id: I38580a5f765c7bb586dcf2786e91be15a8eba235
(cherry picked from commit 59020ba6b1f1013740157c00ff125bd2d99afc76)

* A number of Mistral REST API endpoints support parameters that
  allow to filter colections. For example, we can pass
  do 'GET /v2/actions?name=in:std.' in a query string and Mistral
  will return only actions containing 'std.' in their name.
  This capability was missing in the client APIs, this patch
  adds corresponding parameters in the APIs for actions,
  workflows, executions (workflow executions) and tasks (task
  executions).

TODO:
- Add required tests

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-client-api-filters
Change-Id: Ic49f58626cf129f9c9399268c3cd12cc93eee039
"}]
commit_message:
Add filters to client Python APIs

* A number of Mistral REST API endpoints support parameters that
  allow to filter colections. For example, we can pass
  do 'GET /v2/actions?name=in:std.' in a query string and Mistral
  will return only actions containing 'std.' in their name.
  This capability was missing in the client APIs, this patch
  adds corresponding parameters in the APIs for actions,
  workflows, executions (workflow executions) and tasks (task
  executions).

TODO:
- Add required tests

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-client-api-filters
Change-Id: Ic49f58626cf129f9c9399268c3cd12cc93eee039

commit_message:
(fix gate)Add depends on for test_volume_resize_success_databases

I observed that our gate sometimes reported error test_volume_resize_success_databases[1],
it seems because resize is not completed, but the implementation of
this test, this error does not always occur, I think that depends
on the resize action is completion before test this function.
I've added depends-on  to this function to make sure that waiting
for resize to complete every time and then execute the function.

[1]:http://logs.openstack.org/87/403287/10/check/gate-trove-functional-dsvm-mysql-ubuntu-xenial/3f6e266/console.html#_2016-12-13_23_32_56_023925
Change-Id: I96a8e74495bcdeb71e381862eb0002a46fe62f2e

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should
call 'raise' without any arguments because it shows
the place where an exception occured initially instead
of place where the exception re-raised

Change-Id: Idb133295e495a02adc1cccc0da7a6e94eb6180d7

commit_message:
Fix condition for disabling old Murano services

In cases, during installation Murano plugin, when Murano from
box is installed and was disabled on UI we also need to disable
old Murano services.
Uses list around changedAny argument, to pass an iterable to it.

Change-Id: I813b0c5a8c5fbe7b2db5affa777caceeae273d6a
Related-Bug: #1631379

subject: For Python 3 Common patterns(2/2)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 03:25:33.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/redis/taskmanager.py', 'trove/common/base_exception.py', 'trove/common/stream_codecs.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/helpers/test_helper.py'], 'message': 'For Python 3 Common patterns(2/2)

Modified some common patterns, in order to better support python3.

The following modifications were made:
Replace func.func_name with func.__name__
Replace exceptions.OSError with OSError and remove "import exceptions"
map() and filter() if a list is needed on Python 3:
Replace map(func, data) with [func(item) for item in data]
Replace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with [obj for obj in data if test(obj)]

Change-Id: I868e831799b5ea02e5bf9a66e468aa4d995da21c
Reference:https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns
'}]
commit_message:
For Python 3 Common patterns(2/2)

Modified some common patterns, in order to better support python3.

The following modifications were made:
Replace func.func_name with func.__name__
Replace exceptions.OSError with OSError and remove "import exceptions"
map() and filter() if a list is needed on Python 3:
Replace map(func, data) with [func(item) for item in data]
Replace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with [obj for obj in data if test(obj)]

Change-Id: I868e831799b5ea02e5bf9a66e468aa4d995da21c
Reference:https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-20 06:51:02.000000000', 'files': ['integration/tests/examples/examples/example_generation.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/db2/service.py', 'integration/tests/integration/tests/volumes/driver.py', 'trove/common/db/models.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/configuration_runners.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/vertica/service.py'], 'message': 'For Python 3 Common patterns

The following modifications were made:
Replace "for key in dict.iterkeys()" with "for key in dict"
Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items()
Replace dict.itervalues() with dict.values()
Replace iterator.next() with next(iterator)
Replace basestring with six.string_types

Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types
Change-Id: Idcba33a3d69a27aad7a69f19c9f5f8ef37297500
Reference:https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common patterns
'}]
commit_message:
For Python 3 Common patterns

Modified some common patterns, in order to better support python3.

The following modifications were made:
Replace "for key in dict.iterkeys()" with "for key in dict"
Replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items()
Replace dict.itervalues() with dict.values()
Replace iterator.next() with next(iterator)
Replace basestring with six.string_types
Replace unicode with six.text_type
Replace (str, unicode) with six.string_types
Replace (int, long) with six.integer_types
Change-Id: Idcba33a3d69a27aad7a69f19c9f5f8ef37297500
Reference:https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common patterns

In the 'tool' method, the var 'apply_rule' was tested, and the

commit_message:
Remove dead code and use default value of argparse.

In the 'tool' method, the var 'apply_rule' was tested, and the
method returned if it was true. Then, it was tested again even
though it could only be 'false' (or not be None).
Also, an unused parameter of main() had been removed.

Closes-Bug #1650599
Change-Id: I4b265ef609d4a5fc8128f40359cf8d04ee8cbe28
Signed-off-by: Sami Makki <mail@samimakki.fr>

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-19 08:36:53.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/generalize-pci-device.rst'], 'message': 'Generalize PCI device as Host device

There are some virtual devices are virtualized from physical PCI devices and
have some common characteristics as PCI devices but they may be not real PCI
devices e.g. vGPU, vTPM, vFPGA. If we can generalize PCI devices by
abstracting some common concepts in a top object, we can re-use most of
those exiting PCI code to handle those non-PCI virtual devices. It will be
helpful to make it easier to introduce new devices to OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ibaa9220d7a53eaecdf17cefdcf20ae6d5aee5610
Blueprint: generalize-pci-device
'}]
commit_message:
Generalize PCI device as Host device

There are some virtual devices are virtualized from physical PCI devices and
have some common characteristics as PCI devices but they may be not real PCI
devices e.g. vGPU, vTPM, vFPGA. If we can generalize PCI devices by
abstracting some common concepts in a top object, we can re-use most of
those exiting PCI code to handle those non-PCI virtual devices. It will be
helpful to make it easier to introduce new devices to OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ibaa9220d7a53eaecdf17cefdcf20ae6d5aee5610
Blueprint: generalize-pci-device

commit_message:
Usage of node (un)assignment handlers

New /api/clusters/:id/assignment and
/api/clusters/:id/unassignment endpoints
are intended to assign/remove cluster nodes
without manual management of
pending_addition, pending_deletion flags.

Also, the new handlers allow to remove a deployed node role
from UI.

Related-Bug: #1642165

Change-Id: I43025e8804713c090ace150020954da643640bf6

commit_message:
Add a primary_openstack_network_server_config task

Fuel deploys three controller nodes simultaneously. If the
primary-controller node doesn't execute openstack_network_server_config
task, other controller nodes execute this task, and will fail to start
neutron-server.Because primary-controller node has not populate
neutron-server's database by neutron-db-manage. So add controller's
dependence on primary-controller.

Change-Id: I8c6519dbb1bed6ce418156faf10c4e74c0127a47

commit_message:
Fix '/root/openrc's duplicate declaration

User configures Username(root) and Home directory(/root) in
Operating System Access, and will throw the error that
Credentials_file[/root/openrc] is already declared in deployment.

Change-Id: Ia7f158d5483c350743a2e352191076ade5f8c5f5
Closes-Bug: #1636472
Co-Authored-By: chendengyi <chendy_0598@163.com>

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 02:50:23.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_serialization/jsonutils.py', 'oslo_serialization/msgpackutils.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ifbe7929580ec61a2cd50232794c0cbd0cbf37edc
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].

in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.

see the link [2].

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I6bf760e6f3db50696dc87230c444f9ed493615f0

commit_message:
Ignore prlimit argument on Windows

The built in 'resource' module is used in order to apply process
resource limits. This is not available on Windows.

For the moment, we'll ignore this argument and log a warning
message. In the future, we may provide a portable implementation
for this feature.

Change-Id: I6a82916eb68fbf8737b45a65f71cae1f835d12d1
Closes-Bug: #1627766
(cherry picked from commit 9ac99b675eae255b660b03d3a1e61599d09f8316)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-22 20:23:26.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "RBD: prevent creation of encrypted volumes

At the moment RBD volume encryption is not supported.  Libvirt needs
support for non-block encryption and nova will need a few changes as
well.  Efforts are underway to resolve this, but in the mean time it's
very confusing to users when we allow them to create encrypted volumes
using volume types as stated in the documentation.  Encryption of the
volume will eventually fail, but allowing this creation creates an
unreasonable expectation.

This patch prevents encrypted volume creation for RBD until support has
landed.  At that time, this patch should be reverted.

Change-Id: I0f071a4aea2d6454b71d83055e87d87b9efcc014
(cherry picked from commit 4bf72b0aec1370dfc79a2fba683ed74cb87dea11)
(cherry picked from commit 5d0a89cc51c29a783d9ef5df8d44059e356d1ef8)
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: prevent creation of encrypted volumes

At the moment RBD volume encryption is not supported.  Libvirt needs
support for non-block encryption and nova will need a few changes as
well.  Efforts are underway to resolve this, but in the mean time it's
very confusing to users when we allow them to create encrypted volumes
using volume types as stated in the documentation.  Encryption of the
volume will eventually fail, but allowing this creation creates an
unreasonable expectation.

This patch prevents encrypted volume creation for RBD until support has
landed.  At that time, this patch should be reverted.

Change-Id: I0f071a4aea2d6454b71d83055e87d87b9efcc014
(cherry picked from commit 4bf72b0aec1370dfc79a2fba683ed74cb87dea11)
(cherry picked from commit 5d0a89cc51c29a783d9ef5df8d44059e356d1ef8)

commit_message:
Switch to python 3.5

Use trueorfalse to normalize the values for USE_PYTHON3

Install 3.5 instead of 3.4 When USE_PYTHON3 is specified.
Also, since not many packages are classified correctly, fallback
to looking for just "Programming Language :: Python :: 3" and
log a message for the package to highlight the problem.

Also special case some services that are *almost* ready

Depends-On: Id48e1b328230fcdf97ed1cb4b97f4c3f9cf6eb8a
Depends-On: Ib7d9aa0e0b74a936002e0eea0b3af05102b06a62

commit_message:
placement: change default vhost & port

8778 port was removed from devstack for Nova Placement testing,
it overlaps with OpenStack Senlin.
Instead, we should use /placement vhost.

Note: this change is not backward compatible on purpose, we introduced
the placement service during Ocata cycle.

Change-Id: I74662aa4d6b6179cb8ef759b7d5df82b609aa7cc

subject: Use oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 13719, 'name': 'Naohiro Tamura', 'email': 'naohirot.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'nao'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-16 04:29:21.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'ironic_python_agent/utils.py'], 'message': "Use oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3

This patch replaces python standard base64 library call to
oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3 porting
standard [1].

Use base64 encoding takes 8-bit binary byte data and encodes it. On
Python3, A string is a sequence of Unicode characters thus base64 has
no idea what to do with Unicode data, it's not 8-bit[2]. We use
oslo_serialization.base64 for both python2 and python3.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8908287/base64-encoding-in-python-3

Change-Id: I1dafe878a71f37d223eaf58ea8e2e8c6b4422a14
"}]
commit_message:
Use oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3

This patch replaces python standard base64 library call to
oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3 porting
standard [1].

Use base64 encoding takes 8-bit binary byte data and encodes it. On
Python3, A string is a sequence of Unicode characters thus base64 has
no idea what to do with Unicode data, it's not 8-bit[2]. We use
oslo_serialization.base64 for both python2 and python3.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8908287/base64-encoding-in-python-3

Change-Id: I1dafe878a71f37d223eaf58ea8e2e8c6b4422a14

commit_message:
Add scenario test for neutron-dynamic-routing

I plan that scenario tests are run in ocata and later release and
a existing job for api test will be affected by it.
So the job for api test needs to checked whether it runs on stable/newton.

commit_message:
Log warning if no property for (Un)Set commands

For the OSC baremetal commands that Set or Unset properties of a
chassis or port, a warning is logged if the command is invoked without
any properties being specified. This makes the behaviour similar to
that for the node resource.

Change-Id: I78255924daab12f83ea8221bb7a727726986d2d7

(cherry picked from commit 9ce673803a4bf89606dee6732be1f6f628a98920)

Augeas supports lvm.conf parsing
only starting from version 1.3, and
in Trusty we have augeas 1.2, so we need
to use file_line to edit global_filter.
This is related only to MOS 9.x and Trusty,
in Xenial we have augeas 1.4.

Change-Id: Ic558882781851d90d62737f38fe2e69801751613
Closes-Bug: #1645624
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder lvm filtering

Augeas supports lvm.conf parsing
only starting from version 1.3, and
in Trusty we have augeas 1.2, so we need
to use file_line to edit global_filter.
This is related only to MOS 9.x and Trusty,
in Xenial we have augeas 1.4.

Change-Id: Ic558882781851d90d62737f38fe2e69801751613
Closes-Bug: #1645624

commit_message:
Sync debian-sysmaint password

For mysql under debian we should have configured mysql-user debian-sys-maint
for proper logrotate operation, etc. Right now we have desynchronization
between password stored in debian.cnf and in mysql database.

Closes-Bug: 1650283
Change-Id: I55d0a7c44980d7ebbd9606c08bb0a744f265feec
(cherry picked from commit 76637cfa99e3616f48441df45d592c471afc7788)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 9236, 'name': 'Jon Bernard', 'email': 'jobernar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jbernard'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-01 02:13:00.000000000', 'files': ['os_collect_config/tests/test_zaqar.py', 'os_collect_config/zaqar.py'], 'message': "Add support for Zaqar websockets

This patch adds a new zaqar.use_websockets option which if set to True
in the config file will configure the Zaqar collector to use
the websocket transport instead of wsgi. This can be more efficient
where you want to avoid the continuous polling of o-c-c and instead
just listen on the websocket that is subscribed to a queue.

Like other collectors each iteration creates a new socket object. This
allows us to use the normal re-exec logic in o-c-c and thus gives
the option to re-configure the agent in the future to use other types
of collectors. We could (optionally) look into a higher level option in
the future that would allow o-c-c to avoid re-exec'ing and thus re-use
the same websocket for multiple sets of metadata.

Depends-On: Ia2a8deb599252d8308e44d595eb2bf443999aaad
Change-Id: Id5c7ed590df776844b6c7961eb40f89206cd24e0
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for Zaqar websockets

This patch adds a new zaqar.use_websockets option which if set to True
in the config file will configure the Zaqar collector to use
the websocket transport instead of wsgi. This can be more efficient
where you want to avoid the continuous polling of o-c-c and instead
just listen on the websocket that is subscribed to a queue.

Like other collectors each iteration creates a new socket object. This
allows us to use the normal re-exec logic in o-c-c and thus gives
the option to re-configure the agent in the future to use other types
of collectors. We could (optionally) look into a higher level option in
the future that would allow o-c-c to avoid re-exec'ing and thus re-use
the same websocket for multiple sets of metadata.

Depends-On: Ia2a8deb599252d8308e44d595eb2bf443999aaad
Change-Id: Id5c7ed590df776844b6c7961eb40f89206cd24e0

commit_message:
Fix Inspector grenade: enable devstack plugin once

Add new ironic inspector builder, which disable devstack plugin
because the grenade code in Inspector enables it, and enabling
it twice causes errors.

Also move rest configuration to ironic-inspector-enabled builder.

Change-Id: I733a1cd6d4c843ec4cc870ad78cc1192d55b6e6f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-16 16:47:22.000000000', 'files': ['heat_docker_agent/configure_container.sh'], 'message': 'Heat-agents container: set up trunk repos correctly

I recently hit this error when trying to build the heat-agents container
with trunk repositories:

Error: Package: 1:openstack-puppet-modules-9.3.0-0.20161216011152.8c758d6.el7.centos.noarch (delorean-current)
           Requires: puppet-ec2api

It turns out that the way we set up repositories in the heat-agents
container is different than the way we set up the repositories in
non-containerized developer setups and CI.

This patch makes the trunk repo setup the same as in non-containerized
environments [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/996fb4e69d7445abc98b31adbe7afcc99c11df15/scripts/tripleo.sh#L261-L279

Change-Id: I5cabfd4ad8809674ea968cebfcae5da6453e8c1a
'}]
commit_message:
Heat-agents container: set up trunk repos correctly

I recently hit this error when trying to build the heat-agents container
with trunk repositories:

Error: Package: 1:openstack-puppet-modules-9.3.0-0.20161216011152.8c758d6.el7.centos.noarch (delorean-current)
           Requires: puppet-ec2api

It turns out that the way we set up repositories in the heat-agents
container is different than the way we set up the repositories in
non-containerized developer setups and CI.

This patch makes the trunk repo setup the same as in non-containerized
environments [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/blob/996fb4e69d7445abc98b31adbe7afcc99c11df15/scripts/tripleo.sh#L261-L279

Change-Id: I5cabfd4ad8809674ea968cebfcae5da6453e8c1a

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-12-21 12:25:06.000000000', 'files': ['docker/post.j2.yaml', 'environments/docker.yaml', 'docker/firstboot/start_docker_agents.sh'], 'message': 'Use overcloud-full instead of atomic-image

This switches to using overcloud-full as the OS image for
containerized compute. It includes the following changes:
- install docker, until this change lands
  I1eab2a6de721c8f3c21c7df0019f2d4d1cc3775f
- agent image pull has been removed. This avoids a race between docker
  starting and the current call to pull. This relies on "docker run"
  to do the initial pull and leaves open the option of some other
  prefetch mechanism to do the initial pull
- rely on unit Conflicts= to ensure heat-docker-agents and
  os-collect-config do not run at the same time
- tweaks to host bind mounts
- removal of commands which only apply to atomic

Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2e82634785834a877a4dbdbdcd788a9ac1c14a9d
'}]
commit_message:
Use overcloud-full instead of atomic-image

This switches to using overcloud-full as the OS image for
containerized compute. It includes the following changes:
- install docker, until this change lands
  I1eab2a6de721c8f3c21c7df0019f2d4d1cc3775f
- agent image pull has been removed. This avoids a race between docker
  starting and the current call to pull. This relies on "docker run"
  to do the initial pull and leaves open the option of some other
  prefetch mechanism to do the initial pull
- rely on unit Conflicts= to ensure heat-docker-agents and
  os-collect-config do not run at the same time
- tweaks to host bind mounts
- removal of commands which only apply to atomic

Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2e82634785834a877a4dbdbdcd788a9ac1c14a9d

field cpu_emulator_threads_policy has been added to the object
InstanceNUMATopology.

implements blueprint libvirt-emulator-threads-policy

commit_message:
[ipmitool] Do not try powering off nodes that are already off when rebooting

We already have safeguards when processing power on and off requests, but not when rebooting.

Apparently some IPMI implementation (notably, OVB) have occasional problems with it.

Closes-Bug: #1648126
Change-Id: Ib9e2d0379016c64d0b507725e4ac2c2ab4064629

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-06 08:43:47.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/test_api_versions.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_list_extensions.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/contrib/test_tenant_networks.py'], 'message': 'Use more specific asserts in tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I8be876e0d2a1ea5d6f8454ca973e2d874d10283d
'}]
commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I8be876e0d2a1ea5d6f8454ca973e2d874d10283d

subject: Remove dead code and use default value of argparse.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-02 12:14:09.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/shell.py'], 'message': "Remove dead code and use default value of argparse.

In the 'tool' method, the var 'apply_rule' was tested, and the
method returned if it was true. Then, it was tested again even
though it could only be 'false' (or not be None).
Also, an unused parameter of main() had been removed.

Closes-Bug #1650599
Signed-off-by: Sami Makki <mail@samimakki.fr>

Change-Id: Ie7626f0bcc37887ccc940bb029909f92c8834875
"}]
commit_message:
Remove dead code and use default value of argparse.

In the 'tool' method, the var 'apply_rule' was tested, and the
method returned if it was true. Then, it was tested again even
though it could only be 'false' (or not be None).
Also, an unused parameter of main() had been removed.

Closes-Bug #1650599
Signed-off-by: Sami Makki <mail@samimakki.fr>

Change-Id: Ie7626f0bcc37887ccc940bb029909f92c8834875

commit_message:
Switch main components to transport_url

Messaging rabbit-* parameters are deprecated in upstream, so
this patch switches all main components to usage of transport_url

Partial-Bug: #1477967

commit_message:
Make nova-consoleauth use memcache as cache backend

Now Mirantis OpenStack uses python dictionary's to store
nova-consoleauth tokens and it fails to connect to VNC on
page reload if we use HA cluster, so we need to use
memcache as cache backend.

Change-Id: Ib530c9144d573925d9bc796438485e16e54056df
Closes-Bug: #1576218
(cherry picked from commit fc333aab261e6d255dbf818d2d48ec332f20feb3)

commit_message:
add new library "openstackclient" to OSC team

We are proposing a new library "openstackclient" be added to the
OSC's team governance. The new library is different from the
existing "python-openstackclient", it will install all OSC plugins
by default.

Depends-On: I5349e9ab801219b0ed72e817fb1cc980a5240d59

commit_message:
Add support for https endpoint in auth URI

Since the 'scheme' for the identity endpoint is defined as a
node attribute, we can use this value when constructing the auth
URI in the tempest.conf

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-28 04:38:50.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr/lib/config.py', 'kuryr/lib/opts.py', 'kuryr/lib/utils.py', 'kuryr/tests/unit/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Refactor out keystoneauth code from neutron

* Split get_neutron_client into three methods: get_neutron_client,
  get_auth_plugin, and get_keystone_session.
* Split register_neutron_opts into two methods:
  register_neutron_opts and register_keystoneauth_opts
* Split list_neutron_opts into two methods: list_neutron_opts
  and get_keystoneauth_conf_options

This allows Fuxi to reuse the keystone code to get a cinder
client and generate sample config.

Change-Id: I9053b6d1a669d471a4c6b447fb72591a421a8caa
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor out keystoneauth code from neutron

* Split get_neutron_client into three methods: get_neutron_client,
  get_auth_plugin, and get_keystone_session.
* Split register_neutron_opts into two methods:
  register_neutron_opts and register_keystoneauth_opts
* Split list_neutron_opts into two methods: list_neutron_opts
  and get_keystoneauth_conf_options

This allows Fuxi to reuse the keystone code to get a cinder
client and generate sample config.

Change-Id: I9053b6d1a669d471a4c6b447fb72591a421a8caa

subject: Avoid hard-coding of 'neutron' config group
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-28 00:21:48.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr/lib/utils.py', 'kuryr/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'kuryr/tests/unit/test_config.py'], 'message': "Avoid hard-coding of 'neutron' config group

The name of neutron config group is specified in file
kuryr/lib/config.py. If we want to retrieve the name of this config
group, we should read it from that file instead of hard-coding it.

Change-Id: Id6ebc4fc8433a802edc04b941a591e03d23c489e
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid hard-coding of 'neutron' config group

The name of neutron config group is specified in file
kuryr/lib/config.py. If we want to retrieve the name of this config
group, we should read it from that file instead of hard-coding it.

Change-Id: Id6ebc4fc8433a802edc04b941a591e03d23c489e

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-29 10:38:15.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/legacy_tables_clean.rst'], 'message': 'spec on legacy tables clean work

1. What is the problem?
After the Tricircle narrowed its scope to networking automation across Neutron
servers, many table are deprecated, therefore they should be removed. Other
tables that still exist in the Tricircle need to be renamed for better
understanding.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The detailed description of the problems and the proposals to solve the
problems will be covered in this specification.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
The new features discussed in this specification needs to be implemented.

Change-Id: Idf61ecb30f54e40fde283ee5f3278b2f4b429f66
'}]
commit_message:
spec on legacy tables clean work

1. What is the problem?
After the Tricircle narrowed its scope to networking automation across Neutron
servers, many table are deprecated, therefore they should be removed. Other
tables that still exist in the Tricircle need to be renamed for better
understanding.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
The detailed description of the problems and the proposals to solve the
problems will be covered in this specification.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
The new features discussed in this specification needs to be implemented.

Change-Id: Idf61ecb30f54e40fde283ee5f3278b2f4b429f66

commit_message:
Rename 'format_labels' to 'format_args' in OSC

The rename was done in client. This patch updated the OSC plugin.
Also, remove the hostname and ports as well, since they are
already removed in client.

commit_message:
[POC][placement] Add 'GET /resource_providers/traits' API

The API 'GET /resource_providers/traits' is used for user to query
which traits are supported in the cloud.

Partial implement blueprint resource-provider-tags

Change-Id: I2afda347b12dd1fcdd94806e38be7967d8244a1e

commit_message:
Skip on 'test_volume_from_snapshot' when using Ceph driver

The test 'test_volume_from_snapshot' is failed when using Ceph driver
with delete volume-snapshot time out.
Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1627510

Change-Id: I7bc2848d18c0e0fa00e7823c242e3a900def2fe9

commit_message:
Create a volume type in test level

This patch converts a volume type resource from class level to test level
in order to prevent a shared resource dependence between tests.

subject: Use assertGreater() or assertLess()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-23 03:24:15.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/tests/functional/cli/v2/cli_tests_v2.py'], 'message': 'Use assertGreater() or assertLess()

assertGreater() or assertLess()
will return nicer error if it fails.
So we use assertGreater() or assertLess()
to replace assertTrue()

Change-Id: Ic68e292feac359d8d0053a34d24cb671766fc00a
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertGreater() or assertLess()

assertGreater() or assertLess()
will return nicer error if it fails.
So we use assertGreater() or assertLess()
to replace assertTrue()

Change-Id: Ic68e292feac359d8d0053a34d24cb671766fc00a

commit_message:
Federated authentication via ECP functional tests

Adds a first test for the federated authentication feature. It handles
first the authentication using the SAML2 ECP profile.

The tests cleanup have some issues, see related bug.

Related-Bug: 1642692
Change-Id: I3b393a695c6d9f846efdaf302c1beea34e6bd54b
